title: About Us | Employee & Family Housing
content:
About Us
Our Mission
Employee & Family Housing supports the mission of the University by further enhancing and encouraging the relationships among faculty, staff, students and other members of the San Francisco State community. The interaction that exists between the collective residential community provides unique opportunities for growth with regard to multicultural competencies, respectful community living and development.

title: License Agreement | Employee & Family Housing
content:
License Agreement
2023-2024 License Agreement
FAQs
San Francisco State University Housing is exempt from rent control ordinances - what does this mean?
The University is a State institution providing housing for its affiliates and are not subject to the City of San Francisco rent control ordinance. Therefore, rent and renewal increases are set by the University on an annual basis.
How long does a License Agreement last?
The license term shall commence from the agreed date of move-in and shall continue for one (1) year.
When are my housing fees due and how do I pay them?
Your monthly licensing fee is due on the 1st day of every month.¬†Payments received after the 5th of the month will result in a late fee.
For further details refer to the first page of your License Agreement or go to the '
Payments
' page to learn about payment options.
When do you send out my renewal?
License Agreement renewals will be mailed out to the Primary Licensee a minimum of 30 days prior to termination date.
Eligibility for Renewal:
Anyone who is
no longer
affiliated with San Francisco State University will
not
be eligible for renewal.
Students must be enrolled in at least 15 units at San Francisco State University.
Active faculty/staff will receive a renewal for one (1) year.
What if I don't want to renew my License Agreement?
If you do not wish to renew your License Agreement, a 'Notice of Intent to Vacate' will need to be provided by the Primary Licensee to the Employee & Family Housing Office at least 30 days prior to termination date of License Agreement.
Will there be a penalty for terminating my License Agreement?
An attempt to terminate your Licensee Agreement before the end of term would be considered a breach of contract. An early termination fee of up to two (2) months of your licensing fee may be assessed.
What is the security deposit used for?
The purpose of the security deposit is to cover:
Damages
Excessive wear and tear
Any unpaid licensing fees
Any fees due to the University
Any unmet conditions of the License Agreement
When will my security deposit be returned to me?
Upon termination of your License Agreement, the Security Deposit shall be applied to any damages, delinquent licensing fees, or any fees due to the University. Any remaining balance will only be refunded to the Primary Licensee after all move out requirements have been fulfilled.
Are pets allowed?
One (1) pet is allowed for faculty and staff only. Allowance for more than one pet must be approved by the Employee & Family Housing Office.
A pet deposit is required along with a monthly pet fee.
Is renter's insurance required for my apartment?
The Primary Licensee is
required
to carry personal renter's insurance on their apartment for protection due to fire, flood, theft, personal injury or casualty. The University does not assume responsibility for the loss, damage, or destruction of any personal property kept in the licensed space or on University property. Proof of renter's insurance is required at the time of signing your license agreement or renewal.
Are utilities included in my licensing fees?
The following utilities are included in your fees:
University Park North - electricity, garbage & water
University Park South - garbage and water only
Can I sublet my apartment?
No. Subletting is not allowed. Any attempt to sublet will be considered a breach of contract and is grounds for eviction.

title: Payments | Employee & Family Housing
content:
Payments
Employee & Family Housing will send an electronic statement at the end of each month. These statements give a full financial summary of your account and list the amount that is due on the first of the next month. If you have not yet received a statement via email or have questions about how to pay online, contact the Employee & Family Housing Office at (415) 405-4000 or
employee_housing@sfsu.edu
. Licensing fees are due on the 1st of each month. Payments received after the 5th of the month will result in a late fee.
Licensing fees are due on the 1st of each month. Payments received after the 5th of the month will result in a late fee.
Payment Options
Online
This system is a safe and convenient way to make payments. At first use, you will be required to create an account.
Please Note:¬†All credit/debit card transactions will incur a 2.65% fee. Payment via echeck is free.
Make a Payment
By Mail
Check payments should be made payable to San Francisco State University and mailed to:
Housing Financial Services
750 Font Blvd., Suite 5000
San Francisco, CA 94132
* Do not mail cash.
In-Person
Payments can be made Mon.- Fri. 9:00am-5:00pm at:
Housing Business Office
800 Font Blvd.
San Francisco, CA 94132
After-hours payments can be placed in the deposit box to the right of the Housing Business Office sliding door.
Please Note:
Only online payments, money orders, cashier‚Äôs checks, or personal checks will be accepted.
Late fee: $100¬† |¬† Returned check fee: $25

title: Future Residents | Employee & Family Housing
content:
Future Residents
Welcome to Employee & Family Housing
Why Live On Campus?
Living on campus not only eliminates your commute, but it also brings you closer to campus resources as well as¬†a variety of shops, restaurants, public transportation, and recreation.
Am I Eligible?
Employee & Family Housing is available to current staff, faculty and students with families. Eligibility requirements apply.
Eligibility Requirements
Where Can I Live?
University Park is the best of both worlds - living in one of the most exciting cities without the hassle of a busy downtown.
Housing Options
Residential Dining
Early Childhood Center
Children's Campus
Student Housing

title: Parking | Employee & Family Housing
content:
Parking
Resident Parking Permits
A valid parking permit is required 24 hours a day, seven days a week to park in all campus lots. EFH residents may obtain a reserved covered parking space in EFH designated areas for an additional monthly fee.
Request or Cancel a Parking Permit
Guest Parking
University Park North (UPN) Residents
Residents of UPN are issued one guest parking permit per unit. The guest parking permit may be used in any street parking spot along Buckingham Way.
University Park South (UPS) Residents
Residents of UPS are eligible to obtain an annual residential parking permit from the City of San Francisco. The city permit will allow you to park in any ‚ÄúE‚Äù parking zone (street parking around SF State). Refer to the
Parking Permit flyer
for instructions on how to apply for a parking pass.
